div.p: I recently forgot to include in the packet I sent to you the preface I mentioned in my letters. Therefore, I am now sending it with the supplement, that is, with the booklet itself, intending to add Eber's book, unless I feared burdening the courier. I am working and striving as much as I can to send the response to the Brentanus to the Leipzig fair.
The plague continues to rage in Lyon.
I entrust to you the matter of the alliance.
A rumor has arisen here that there is a call to arms there. May the Lord grant that we soon hear better news and that the good may enjoy holy peace with that ferocity subdued.
May the Lord Jesus keep you safe with all your colleagues.
Here with us, by God's grace, whatever plague there was is now almost quelled. Farewell again.
I received your last letter on this same day along with one additional page of your book; but you did not send the first part of it.
